title: Module 10: Cybersecurity Principles, Practices and Processes

questions.question: What is identified by the first dimension of the cybersecurity cube?
questions.explanation: The first dimension of the cybersecurity cube identifies the goals or security principles required to protect the cyber world.

questions.question: What type of cybersecurity laws protect you from an organization that might want to share your sensitive data?
questions.explanation: Privacy laws control appropriate use of data and access to data.

questions.question: Which two methods help to ensure data integrity? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Data integrity systems include methods such as hashing and data consistency checks.

questions.question: What name is given to a storage device connected to a network?
questions.explanation: NAS refers to a storage device connected to a network that allows storage and retrieval of data from a centralized location by authorized network users.

questions.question: What is a method of sending information from one device to another using removable media?
questions.explanation: Sneaker net refers to hand delivering the removable data.

questions.question: Which data state is maintained in NAS and SAN services?
questions.explanation: A cybersecurity specialist must be familiar with the types of technologies used to store, transmit, and process data. NAS and SAN services maintain stored data.

questions.question: Which type of networks poses increasing challenges to cybersecurity specialists due to the growth of BYOD on campus?
questions.explanation: The growth of BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) on campus primarily increases the use and challenges of wireless networks.

questions.question: An organization allows employees to work from home two days a week. Which technology should be implemented to ensure data confidentiality as data is transmitted?
questions.explanation: Protecting data confidentiality during transmission requires encryption technologies such as VPNs (Virtual Private Networks).

questions.question: Which of the following are types of sensitive information? (Select three answers)
questions.explanation: There are three types of sensitive information: personal information, business information, and classified information. This type of information must be protected from unauthorized access.

questions.question: Which of the following are foundational principles of the cybersecurity domain? (Select three answers)
questions.explanation: There are three foundational principles of security: confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Together these three principles make up the security triad.

questions.question: What tasks are accomplished by a comprehensive security policy? (Select three answers)

options.text: It defines legal consequences of violations
It is is useful for management
It gives security staff the backing of management
It sets rules for expected behavior

questions.explanation: The security policy of an organization sets the rules for expected behavior, defines the legal consequences of violations, and gives security staff the backing of management.
